AccessModifier.Definition: Access modifier keywords control where code elements like classes, methods, and fields can be accessed from, helping enforce encapsulation and safe boundaries between parts of a program.

QuotedString.Definition: Quoted strings represent a sequence of characters enclosed in double quotes (") on the same line.

CompilationScope.Definition: These keywords set up the overall structure and context of a file before any code runs. They control where code belongs, how names are organized, and which other code can be referenced.
